item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm‚Äôs length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm‚Äôs length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

The article discusses the Indian government's reluctance to engage with protesting farmers who have been calling for a legal guarantee for minimum support prices and other reforms. The Union Agriculture Minister has indicated the government is waiting for Supreme Court directives before initiating talks.

  • The protests are led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha.
  • Farmers have been protesting at the Punjab-Haryana borders since February last year.
  • The current government is taking a more hands-off approach compared to previous administrations.
‚ÄúAbhi to Supreme Court dekh raha hai. Supreme Court ke jo nirdesh honge unaka paalan kiya jaega.‚Äù - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

The article highlights a shift in the Modi government's strategy towards farmer protests, emphasizing caution and reliance on judicial outcomes rather than direct negotiations.

item.title: Bastar journalist murder: Prime accused Suresh Chandrakar arrested by SIT in Hyderabad - The Times of India
item.description:
Bastar journalist murder: Prime accused Suresh Chandrakar arrested by SIT in Hyderabad

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

The Special Investigation Team (SIT) has arrested Suresh Chandrakar, the primary suspect in the murder of a journalist in Bastar. The arrest took place in Hyderabad.

  • Suresh Chandrakar is charged with the murder of journalist Sukhram Soni.
  • The murder has raised concerns over journalist safety in the region.
  • The SIT has been conducting thorough investigations to ensure justice.
"The arrest is a significant step forward in ensuring justice for our colleagues and fighting for journalist safety." - Statement from the Journalist Union

This arrest highlights ongoing concerns regarding the safety of journalists in India and serves as a reminder for the need for stronger protections.

item.title: Cold wave grips Delhi, light rain expected today; Kashmir sees fresh snowfall - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Cold Wave and Light Rain Expected in Delhi Amid Fresh Snowfall in Kashmir

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Inclement weather continues to grip Delhi with light rain expected, while Kashmir experiences fresh snowfall. The Indian Meteorological Department has warned of a cold wave affecting the national capital.

  • Cold wave conditions reported in Delhi, with a recorded temperature of 11.4 degrees Celsius.
  • IMD predicts a cloudy sky with light rain for Delhi on Monday.
  • Homeless individuals are utilizing night shelters to escape the harsh weather.
  • Air quality in Delhi classified as 'very poor', with an AQI of 316.
  • Fresh snowfall reported in several regions of Kashmir, maintaining subzero temperatures.
"Several trains were running late at New Delhi Railway Station due to dense fog in various parts of Uttar Pradesh and Punjab."

The severe weather continues to impact daily life in the region, prompting residents to seek warmth and shelter.

item.title: BPSC protest: Patna Police detains Prashant Kishor, vacates Gandhi Maidan - The Hindu
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Arrested After Hunger Strike Over BPSC Exam Allegations

Published on January 06, 2025 by The Hindu

Prashant Kishor, founder of Jan Suraaj, was arrested while on a fast-unto-death demanding the cancellation of a Bihar PSC exam due to alleged question paper leaks.

  • Kishor began his hunger strike on January 2, 2025.
  • He and his supporters were removed from the Gandhi Maidan protest site by police.
  • Kishor was taken to Patna AIIMS for a medical check-up post-arrest.
  • The protest was deemed illegal by authorities due to its location near a restricted area.
  • Over 5,943 out of 12,012 candidates attended the retest of the BPSC exam held on January 4.
‚ÄúYes, Kishor and his supporters sitting on dharna at Gandhi Maidan, were arrested by the police on Monday morning. They will now be produced before a court.‚Äù - Chandrashekhar Singh, District Magistrate

The BPSC had announced a retest for select candidates amidst the controversy, which was conducted without any reported issues.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: BPSC exam row: Prashant Kishor arrested in Patna after sitting for hunger strike - The Hindu
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Arrested during Hunger Strike over BPSC Exam Controversy

Published on: January 06, 2025, Source: Press Trust of India

Prashant Kishor was arrested while on an indefinite hunger strike protesting the 70th Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) exam following allegations of a paper leak.

  • Kishor began his hunger strike on January 2, demanding a cancellation of the BPSC exam and a high-level investigation.
  • His demands included an unemployment allowance for youths and actions against those responsible for irregularities.
  • Despite ongoing protests, the BPSC conducted a re-examination on January 4 at specific centers.
  • Kishor vowed not to leave until the Chief Minister addressed student concerns.
  • Of the 12,012 candidates scheduled for a re-examination, only 5,943 attended.
‚ÄúKishor had vowed not to move from his spot until Chief Minister Nitish Kumar personally met with the students‚Äù

This incident underscores the tensions surrounding the BPSC exams and student protests in Bihar.

item.title: After 8 years, Namma Metro set to raise fares by 40-45% - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Namma Metro Fare Set to Increase by 40-45% After Eight Years

Published: 05 January 2025, 23:55 IST

Bengaluru's Namma Metro is planning a fare hike of 40-45% following recommendations made by a government panel after almost eight years of unchanged fares. The increase is set to take effect from the end of January 2025.

  • The fare fixation committee recommended raising the base fare to around Rs 15 and the maximum fare to Rs 85 from Rs 60.
  • Public feedback was collected from October 2 to 28, 2024, and the final report was submitted last week.
  • To mitigate the fare increase impact, discounts will be available during off-peak hours and for smartcard/QR code users.
  • Operational costs have significantly increased since the last revision in 2017, including a rise in maintenance costs by over 300%.
  • Comparatively, other cities like Delhi have implemented even higher fare hikes under similar circumstances.
  • Criticism from passengers is anticipated due to recent bus fare increases as well.
"If the BMRCL does not have adequate cash surplus to meet growing expenses, the quality of metro services may get affected."

The committee stresses that the hike is necessary to ensure the continued quality and sustainability of the metro service amidst rising operating costs.

item.title: 'Roads Like Priyanka Gandhi's Cheeks': BJP Leader Bidhuri's Remark Draws Congress Ire - News18
item.description:
BJP Leader Ramesh Bidhuri's Sexist Remark on Priyanka Gandhi Sparks Outrage

Last Updated: January 05, 2025, 23:30 IST | Source: News18

A massive political controversy arose after BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri made a sexist comment about Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi during a campaign speech, prompting Congress to threaten legal action.

  • Bidhuri stated that the BJP would build "roads like Priyanka Gandhi‚Äôs cheeks" if elected.
  • Congress responded sharply, planning to file an FIR and accusing the BJP of sexism.
  • Following backlash, Bidhuri expressed regret and claimed he would retract his statement.
  • Congress officials criticized the BJP for its treatment of women and called for accountability from party leaders.
‚ÄúBJP is against women. Ramesh Bidhuri‚Äôs remarks against Priyanka Gandhi are shameful. This is the real face of the BJP.‚Äù - Congress Leader Supriya Shrinate

This incident underscores the ongoing tensions between the BJP and Congress, especially regarding issues related to women's rights and political discourse.

item.title: Prashant Kishor detained amid hunger strike to support BPSC exam protesters - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Arrested During Hunger Strike to Support BPSC Exam Protesters

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prashant Kishor, the chief of Jan Suraaj, was arrested by Bihar Police while on an indefinite hunger strike in Patna to demand the cancellation of the BPSC examination amid allegations of irregularities.

  • Kishor began the hunger strike on Thursday to support students protesting against the BPSC examination held on December 13.
  • His arrest occurred as he and supporters were removed from Gandhi Maidan by police.
  • The government recently announced a re-examination, leading Kishor to claim it acknowledged errors in the original test.
  • Kishor called for swift action from Chief Minister Nitish Kumar to address student concerns.
‚ÄúBy conducting the re-examination, the government has legally accepted that irregularities have happened with certain students in the examination.‚Äù ‚Äì Prashant Kishor

This incident underscores the ongoing tensions surrounding the BPSC exam and student protests in Bihar, with calls for further support from political leaders.

item.title: BPSC protest: Bihar Police detains Prashant Kishor from Gandhi Maidan in Patna - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Detained During Hunger Strike for BPSC Exam Protest

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

Prashant Kishor, chief of Jan Suraaj, has been detained by Bihar Police while on an indefinite hunger strike at Gandhi Maidan, protesting against irregularities in the BPSC examination and demanding the cancellation of the integrated 70th combined competitive test conducted in December.

  • Kishor's hunger strike aimed to draw attention to alleged irregularities in the BPSC examination.
  • He claims the government's decision to conduct a re-examination acknowledges errors in the initial testing process.
  • Over 12,000 candidates were called for a fresh test; however, only 5,943 appeared.
  • Kishor has called for political support to amplify the protest.
‚ÄúBy conducting the re-examination, the government has legally accepted that irregularities have happened with certain students in the examination.‚Äù ‚Äì Prashant Kishor

This ongoing protest highlights significant concerns regarding the integrity of public examinations in Bihar and the need for government accountability.

item.title: TMC's Babul Supriyo Vs BJP's Abhijit Gangopadhyay On Kolkata Road Over Erratic Driving | Video - News18
item.description:
Verbal Spat Between TMC's Babul Supriyo and BJP's Abhijit Gangopadhyay in Kolkata

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

West Bengal minister and Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo and BJP MP Abhijit Gangopadhyay entered into a verbal spat over alleged car honking on Kolkata‚Äôs Vidyasagar Bridge.

  • Supriyo alleged his car was stopped and he was verbally abused.
  • Gangopadhyay claimed Supriyo used foul language against him.
  • Videos of the incident showed a crowd near their vehicles.
  • The police intervened to bring the situation under control.
üö®SHOCKINGLast night , BJP MP and Former Justice , Shri #AbhijitGanguly was passing through Hooghly bridge when TMC MLA Babul Supriyo stopped his car and started harassing him.

Both leaders nearly came to blows, highlighting tensions between the two political parties in the region.

item.title: Tourists escape drowning in frozen Sela Lake - The Arunachal Times
item.description:
Tourists Escape Drowning in Frozen Sela Lake

Date: 5 Jan | Source: Arunachal Times

Four tourists had a narrow escape at Sela Lake when they fell through the ice while trying to walk on the frozen surface. Their companions quickly rescued them.

  • The incident involved a group of four tourists, including a woman.
  • Despite warnings from local authorities, tourists have continued to walk on frozen lakes in the region.
  • High-altitude lakes like Sela Lake are considered sacred by local traditions.
‚ÄúFiddling with or polluting such lakes invites fatal trouble.‚Äù

This incident serves as a vital reminder of the dangers associated with walking on frozen bodies of water, especially in high-altitude areas.

item.title: Namo Bharat Trains Now In Delhi: All You Need To Know About RRTS Corridor To Meerut | Explained - News18
item.description:
Namo Bharat Trains Now In Delhi: All You Need To Know About RRTS Corridor To Meerut

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Delhi section of the RRTS, marking the arrival of Namo Bharat trains in the capital. This 13-km section connects Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh to New Ashok Nagar, completing a 55 km corridor with 11 stations.

  • The operation will begin at 5 pm with trains available every 15 minutes.
  • The fare ranges from Rs 20 to Rs 225 depending on coach type.
  • The RRTS aims to alleviate traffic, remove over one lakh private vehicles, and reduce carbon emissions annually.
  • New Ashok Nagar is the first elevated station in this corridor.
  • Multiple operational stations now connect Meerut directly to Delhi.
‚ÄúThe project will push employment generation and open up new commercial hubs across NCR.‚Äù

This new transport system is designed to enhance regional connectivity and ease the commuting burden for residents of NCR.

item.title: Complement, don‚Äôt compete, Revanth tells TG, AP Telugus - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
Complement, don‚Äôt compete, Revanth tells TG, AP Telugus

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy emphasized the need for Telangana and Andhra Pradesh to complement each other in development rather than compete, during his address at the World Telugu Federation‚Äôs biennial conference.

  • Revanth Reddy recalled major contributions of notable Telugu leaders in national politics.
  • He advocated for a collaborative mechanism for resolving issues between the two states.
  • The government plans to issue official documents and court judgments in Telugu to promote the language.
  • Reddy urged Telugu industrialists to invest in Hyderabad for the development of Telangana.
  • Hyderabad is highlighted as a prime investment destination due to its infrastructure developments.
‚ÄúThere is a compelling need to protect Telugu language, which can be achieved by conducting a number of meetings.‚Äù

In conclusion, Reddy‚Äôs remarks underline the importance of unity and investment to foster growth in both states while preserving the Telugu language and culture.

item.title: US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India - News18
item.description:
US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

American influencer Kristen Fischer discusses her cultural challenges with Indian dinner traditions, highlighting how they differ from American customs.

  • Fischer has lived in New Delhi for several years.
  • In the US, meals are served upon guests' arrival; in India, they are served at the end of gatherings.
  • Food is often served much later in India, leading to feelings of hunger and confusion for guests used to American customs.
  • Fischer expressed her struggle to adapt, finding the delay in dinner challenging.
  • She shared experiences of leaving friends' homes late without being served dinner.
‚ÄúI can‚Äôt be the only one who struggles with this cultural difference. It is so hard for me!‚Äù

The cultural differences in dining etiquette highlight the significance of understanding diverse traditions and their impacts on social gatherings.

item.title: P.V. Anvar arrested after day-long standoff over tribal youth‚Äôs death in elephant attack - The Hindu
item.description:
P.V. Anvar Arrested Following Standoff Over Tribal Youth's Death in Elephant Attack

Published: January 05, 2025 10:59 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

P.V. Anvar, an Independent MLA, was arrested after a day-long standoff with police following an attack on the Divisional Forest Office during a protest over a tribal youth's death caused by an elephant attack.

  • Anvar surrendered after police surrounded his house in Othai, Kerala.
  • He criticized Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan for using police action against him.
  • Anvar claimed he was targeted for speaking out on behalf of farmers in the Christian community.
  • The protest was ignited by the death of a tribal man, Mani, who was trampled by an elephant.
  • The government announced ‚Çπ10 lakh assistance to Mani's family.
‚ÄúI will show what I can do if I come back alive,‚Äù P.V. Anvar stated during his arrest.

The incident has drawn significant attention to the ongoing issues around wildlife interactions and local communities in Kerala.

item.title: Unable to speak, stand up: Doctors, SKM leaders offer health update on Jagjit Singh Dallewal - The Times of India
item.description:
Health Update on Jagjit Singh Dallewal: Unable to Speak or Stand

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: Times of India

Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a key figure in the ongoing farmer's protests, has reportedly faced severe health challenges, making him unable to speak or stand.

  • Dallewal is currently under medical care.
  • Doctors express concern over his deteriorating health condition.
  • He remains a prominent voice among farmers despite his health issues.
  • Supporters are rallying around him during this tough time.
"His health has taken a turn for the worse, and we are monitoring the situation closely." - Medical Team

The situation calls for immediate attention as Dallewal continues to be an influential leader in the movement.

item.title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin offers $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley script - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tamil Nadu CM Stalin offers $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley script

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has announced a $1 million prize for deciphering the Indus Valley script, a puzzle that has remained unsolved for over a century. This initiative aims to encourage research and understanding of one of the earliest civilizations.

  • Stalin highlighted the historical significance of the Indus Valley Civilization's discovery in 1924.
  • The prize is intended for individuals or organizations that can decode the Indus writing system.
  • A ‚Çπ2 crore grant will be provided for a research chair named after scholar Iravatham Mahadevan.
  • Stalin discussed the cultural importance of bulls in the Indus Valley civilization in relation to Tamil heritage.
  • Annual awards will be given to scholars who contribute to the understanding of Tamil culture.
‚ÄúMany were telling before that the Ariyam and Sanskrit were India‚Äôs roots; imagination was claimed as history.‚Äù - CM Stalin

The initiative by CM Stalin seeks to revive interest in the Indus Valley Civilization and draw attention to its unresolved mysteries, aiming for a breakthrough in understanding the script and culture which remains largely enigmatic.

item.title: 'Atishi changed her father': After Priyanka comment, BJP's Bidhuri lands in more trouble; 'shameless', sa - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP's Bidhuri Faces Backlash After Priyanka's Comments, Kejriwal Calls Him 'Shameless'

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

After a comment made by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi, BJP's Bidhuri has found himself in hot water, leading to sharp criticism from various political figures, including Arvind Kejriwal, who labeled him as 'shameless'.

  • Bidhuri's controversial remarks came in response to Priyanka's statements regarding his political actions.
  • Kejriwal's strident remarks highlight the increasing tensions in political discourse.
  • This incident has drawn attention to the political dynamics between BJP and Congress as elections approach.
'Shameless' is how Kejriwal described Bidhuri's comments following Priyanka's statements.

This incident underscores the fierce nature of current political debates in India and the growing scrutiny politicians face for their comments.

item.title: Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut | Weather wrap - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave and dense fog have resulted in freezing temperatures and significantly reduced visibility across northern India, prompting widespread disruptions in transportation.

  • Delhi experienced its longest spell of fog, leading to cancellations of hundreds of flights and trains due to zero visibility conditions.
  • In Jharkhand, schools will be closed from January 7-13 due to the cold wave affecting the region.
  • Kashmir saw fresh snowfall while temperatures dipped to below freezing in various areas, with Kokernag recording minus 8.1 degrees Celsius.
  • Cold conditions persisted in Punjab and Haryana with minimum temperatures dropping significantly.
  • Many schools in Bihar's Patna also closed due to ongoing cold wave conditions.
The maximum temperature in Delhi settled at 18.6 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was recorded at 9.4 degrees Celsius.

As weather conditions remain concerning, authorities anticipate further cold weather and possible rain and thunderstorms in the coming days.

item.title: Mukesh Chandrakar: Body of missing Indian journalist found in septic tank - BBC.com
item.description:
Body of Missing Indian Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar Found

Publication Date: January 5, 2023 | Source: Various Media Outlets

The body of Mukesh Chandrakar, a journalist who reported on corruption, has been discovered in a septic tank in Chhattisgarh after he went missing on New Year's Day. His family had filed a police complaint when he disappeared.

Key Points:

  • Mukesh Chandrakar was reported missing on January 1, 2023.
  • His body was found on January 5 in the compound of a construction contractor.
  • Three arrests have been made, including two relatives.
  • Police found severe injuries indicating a violent death.
  • Bastar Junction, his YouTube channel, reported on local corruption.
  • The Press Council of India is calling for a full investigation.
  • Local journalists held protests following his death.
‚ÄúAttacks on journalists reporting on corruption or environmental degradation is not uncommon in India.‚Äù - Reporters Without Borders

This incident highlights the dangers faced by journalists in India, particularly those reporting on sensitive issues like corruption.

item.title: Parvesh Verma, Arvind Kejriwal's New Delhi rival, makes big 'Sheesh Mahal' attack: 'Declare it...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parvesh Verma Accuses Arvind Kejriwal Over 'Sheesh Mahal'

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Parvesh Verma, a former BJP MP, has launched an attack on AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal, calling for his official residence to be declared a tourist spot as a critique of alleged misuse of taxpayer money.

  • Parvesh Verma has been named the BJP's candidate for New Delhi in upcoming elections.
  • He claims the construction of Kejriwal's 'Sheesh Mahal' used public funds, demanding transparency.
  • Verma stated, 'People should know how Kejriwal looted them,' expressing a desire for public access to the residence.
  • Prime Minister Modi has also criticized the AAP for perceived inaction over the years, promoting the BJP's agenda.
  • Kejriwal has rebutted Modi's criticisms, arguing they detract from the issues faced by Delhi's residents.
‚ÄúSheesh Mahal should be declared a tourist spot. The people of Delhi should know how the person who looted, betrayed, Delhi, who sold their dreams, got the 'Sheesh Mahal' built.‚Äù - Parvesh Verma

This political rivalry heats up as Delhi heads toward the 2025 assembly elections, showcasing divergent strategies and narratives from the BJP and AAP.
